title: Congaree National Park: Planning
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Planning            Planning       The Foundation Document provides basic guidance for decision-making and management of Congaree National Park. The document presents a shared understanding of the purpose, significance, fundamental resources and values, primary interpretive themes, and special mandates for Congaree National Park. It also documents the desired conditions for the park, providing the broadest level of direction for management based on laws and policies that guide the National Park Service. The Management Plan for Non-Native Pigs provides information on the park's course of action to reduce natural and cultural resource impacts associated with wild pigs and to reduce risks to human health and safety. The environmental assessment (EA) associated with the management plan analyzes potential impacts to the human environment.
